question_sentence: Who did David Cameron have a surprise meeting with in the US?
evidence: Cameron, the UK foreign secretary, visited the former US president at his Mar-a-Lago home in Florida to try to persuade the de facto leader of the Republican Party to allow Congress to push through $60 billion in military aid for Ukraine.

question_sentence: A senior judge in which country accused Elon Musk of waging a public "disinformation campaign"?
evidence: Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes initiated an investigation into Musk, citing a public "disinformation campaign", after refusing to comply with a court order to block certain accounts on X. Moraes labelled the X owner's actions an "obstruction of Brazilian justice" and "disrespect" for the country's sovereignty.

question_sentence: Which MP tabled a Commons amendment that would end the prosecution of women who terminate pregnancies after the 24-week limit?
evidence: The Labour chair of the Home Affairs Committee has tabled an amendment to the Criminal Justice Bill calling for abortion to be fully decriminalised in England and Wales after a spate of prosecutions of women in the past five years.

question_sentence: Which women's basketball team won this year's NCAA championship, which drew a TV audience bigger than the men's event for the first time?
evidence: The Gamecocks won the championship after defeating superstar Caitlin Clark and the Iowa Hawkeyes 87-75. The game was watched by an average of 18.9 million TV viewers, while the men's final attracted 14.8 million.

question_sentence: Which Ukrainian city is facing being turned into a "grey zone" – ie, uninhabitable – due to constant Russian drone strikes?
evidence: Since February, Ukraine's second-largest city has been subjected to a wave of drone attacks as Russia intensifies its bombardment of the strategically important city ahead of a possible major summer offensive.

question_sentence: Republicans are trying to get the Electoral College system changed in which US state reportedly at the behest of Donald Trump?
evidence: Most states operate on a "winner-take-all" system for Electoral College votes. Not Nebraska. Republicans tend to win the statewide popular vote, but Democrats have often prevailed in the "competitive 2nd District" centred in Omaha.GOP lawmakers are now trying to shift to a winner-take-all system, which would benefit their candidate, Trump.

question_sentence: M&S is investing £1 million to improve the diet of its dairy cows in an effort to curb emissions of which gas?
evidence: M&S claims that switching its dairy cows to a diet derived from mineral salts and a by-product of fermented corn will reduce methane production during digestion, cutting the carbon footprint of the cows' milk by 8.4%.

question_sentence: A recent study found that providing people with what object can boost a person's earnings in low-income countries?
evidence: The study examined more than 800 people from 56 villages in Bangladesh. It concluded that providing them with glasses "increases income in near vision-intensive occupations and may facilitate return to work for those currently unemployed".

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak has been accused of making a brand of trainers uncool by wearing which shoes?
evidence: When the claim was put to him, Sunak told LBC's Nick Ferrari: "I issue a fulsome apology to the Samba community. But, in my defence, I would say I have been wearing Adidas trainers including Sambas – and others, in fact – for many, many years."

question_sentence: The Botswanan president has threatened to send 20,000 of which animal to Germany?
evidence: After the German government said it wants to ban the importing of hunting trophies, Botswana's President Mokgweetsi Masisi threatened to send 20,000 elephants to Germany. Botswana has seen a surge in its elephant population, and allowing elephants to be hunted is an "important means to keep them in check", Masisi said.

question_sentence: Which global leader was invited to the White House this week for a lavish state visit?
evidence: President Joe Biden hosted Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida for a state visit Wednesday. The agenda included a glitzy dinner aimed at intertwining and highlighting American and Japanese cultures.

question_sentence: What type of weather impacted millions across the Southern US this week?
evidence: A powerful storm system that caused flooding and spawned tornadoes swept through the South and the Mississippi Valley.

question_sentence: Which car company has come under intense scrutiny for its Autopilot technology?
evidence: Tesla’s Autopilot system has faced widespread criticism from prominent safety groups. This week, the embattled company settled a major lawsuit filed by the family of a former Apple engineer who died after his Tesla Model X crashed while the Autopilot feature was engaged.

question_sentence: OJ Simpson, one of the most controversial figures of the 20th century, died of cancer this week. His 1995 trial captivated national attention and eclipsed his athletic achievements in which sport?
evidence: While Simpson was a highly decorated football star, he became even more of a household name during his 1995 trial. Simpson was ultimately acquitted in the brutal killings of his ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ron Goldman.

question_sentence: Which prestigious tournament kicked off this week?
evidence: The 88th edition of The Masters is underway at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia.

question_sentence: Which political figure joined TikTok this week — but promised not to dance?
evidence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he created a TikTok account to connect with a younger audience — and he vowed he would not dance on it. “I don’t dance. Promise,” Scholz said in a statement.

question_sentence: Which airline announced it intends to furlough around 260 pilots this fall?
evidence: In a move to save cash, Spirit Airlines is furloughing around 260 pilots effective September 1.

question_sentence: Which state Senate passed a controversial bill that would allow teachers to carry concealed handguns at K-12 schools?
evidence: Tennessee teachers would be allowed to carry concealed handguns at K-12 schools under a bill passed this week by the state Senate.

question_sentence: Which type of bug will emerge in record numbers across the US this spring?
evidence: Billions of noisy cicadas will soon dig their way out from underground in a massive emergence that won’t happen again until 2245.

question_sentence: A lone lottery ticket recently won the $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot. Where was the ticket sold?
evidence: A single ticket sold in Oregon won what's believed to be the fourth-largest jackpot in the history of the game.
